rules: Rule1: If a platform requires a license for alcohol, then it has age verification for alcohol.
Rule2: Whenever a platform implements restrictions for a time period, that time period is during peak hours or during off hours.
Rule3: In the event that a platform receives a complaint for a time period, it implements restrictions for that time period.
Rule4: Should a platform comply with rules for a game, then either it appeals a decision for that game or, if it tracks usage for the game, it operates legally.
Rule5: A platform is under investigation for a game or it faces an audit for the game.
Rule6: If a platform faces an audit for a game, then it receives a warning for the game or complies with rules for the game.
Rule7: Either a platform disputes a finding for a game, or if it is under investigation for the game, then it receives a warning for the game or complies with rules for the game.

Rule8: If a user is a minor, then if it is not the case that not (the user violates the terms of service or is not banned from the platform) implies the user receives a suspension, then the user does not receive a permanent ban.
Rule9: A user is a minor or has a fake account.

Rule10: In the event that a user has a fake account, then if it is not the case that not (the user violates the terms of service or is not banned from the platform) implies the user receives a suspension, then the user does not receive a permanent ban.

Rule11: If a platform commits a first-time offense for alcohol, then if it is not the case that not (the platform has age verification for alcohol implies it operates legally) implies the platform does not violate regulation for alcohol, then the platform qualifies for an appeal for alcohol.

Rule12: Should a platform commit a repeat offense for alcohol, then if it is not the case that not (the platform has age verification for alcohol implies it operates legally) implies the platform does not violate regulation for alcohol, then the platform qualifies for an appeal for alcohol.
Rule13: Whenever a platform self-reports for alcohol, it commits a first-time offense for alcohol.
Rule14: A platform self-reports for alcohol or is reported by others for alcohol.
Rule15: If a platform is reported by others for alcohol, then it commits a repeat offense for alcohol.

Rule16: In the event that a platform performs emergency maintenance for a time period, then if it is not the case that the time period is during peak hours or during off hours, then the platform has special permission for the time period.
Rule17: Provided that a platform is in good standing for a game, it complies with rules for the game.
Rule18: If a platform has a conflicting policy for a game, then it has clear guidelines for the game.
Rule19: A platform has a conflicting policy for a game or is in good standing for the game.
Rule20: A platform has a technical issue with a user or, if it is not the case that the user violates the terms of service or is not banned from the platform, then the user receives a suspension.
Rule21: A platform has a user error with a user or, if the platform has a confirmed bug with the user, then if it has a technical issue with the user, it has a system error with the user.
Rule22: If a time period is during peak hours, then the platform passes content review for a game.
Rule23: In the event that a time period is during off hours, the platform does not fail content review for a game.
Rule24: If it is not the case that the platform has age verification for alcohol implies it operates legally, then the platform violates regulation for alcohol.
Rule25: Provided that it is not the case that the user violates the terms of service or is not banned from the platform, the user does not receive a suspension.
Rule26: Whenever it is not the case that the platform has a conflicting policy for a game implies it does not have clear guidelines for the game, the platform needs a policy review for the game.

Rule27: If it is not the case that the platform has a conflicting policy for a game implies it does not have clear guidelines for the game, then the platform does not need a policy review for the game.
Rule28: In the event that it is not the case that the platform monitors content for a game implies it operates legally, the platform fails content review for the game.
Rule29: If it is not the case that a time period is during peak hours or during off hours, then the platform does not have special permission for the time period.

Rule30: Whenever it is not the case that not (the platform has age verification for alcohol implies it operates legally) implies the platform does not violate regulation for alcohol, the platform is exempt from penalty for alcohol.
Rule31: If it is not the case that not (the user violates the terms of service or is not banned from the platform) implies the user receives a suspension, then the user receives a permanent ban.
Rule32: Should a platform not operate legally, then a user is banned from the platform.
facts: Fact1: A platform requires a license for alcohol.
Fact2: A platform receives a complaint for a time period.
Fact3: A platform tracks usage for a game.
Fact4: A platform performs emergency maintenance for a time period.
Fact5: A platform has a confirmed bug with a user.
Fact6: A platform monitors content for a game.
Fact7: It is not the case that a platform appeals a decision for a game.
Fact8: It is not the case that a platform receives a warning for a game.
Fact9: It is not the case that a platform disputes a finding for a game.
Fact10: It is not the case that a user violates the terms of service.
Fact11: It is not the case that a platform qualifies for an appeal for alcohol.
Fact12: It is not the case that a platform has a system error with a user.
Fact13: It is not the case that a platform has a user error with a user.
Fact14: It is not the case that a platform is exempt from penalty for alcohol.
Fact15: It is not the case that a platform passes content review for a game.
